intro: Crassothonna alba, commonly known as the white crassothonna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
